presentation_title: The Gen AI Landscape And World Of Open Source AI
episode: Episode 1: Gen AI Landscape and Open Source AI
learning_objectives: Differentiate proprietary and open-source Generative AI models.
Identify key players and foundational models in the Gen AI ecosystems.
Explain benefits and challenges of leveraging open-source AI.
Formulate effective prompts for a Generative AI model.
outline: Deeper Dive into Open Source AI
Challenges and Future of Open Source AI
prerequisites: Basic computer literacy and an interest in Artificial Intelligence.

slides.title: Welcome to our tutorial!
content: The Gen AI Landscape And World Of Open Source AI
Presented by EduPyramids / FOSSEE, IIT Bombay
narration: Hello everyone!
Welcome to this exciting tutorial on Generative AI.
Today, we will explore the Gen AI Landscape.
slides.image_prompt: A futuristic digital landscape with various AI symbols, connecting lines, and a prominent 'Generative AI' title. Include FOSSEE and EduPyramids logos subtly.

slides.title: Learning Objectives
content: Differentiate proprietary and open-source Gen AI models.
Identify key players and foundational models.
Explain benefits and challenges of open-source AI.
Formulate effective prompts for Gen AI models.
narration: At the end of this tutorial, you will be able to:
First, differentiate proprietary and open-source Gen AI models.
Second, identify key players and foundational models.
Third, explain benefits and challenges of open-source AI.
Finally, you will formulate effective prompts for Gen AI models.
slides.image_prompt: A graphic displaying four bullet points with checkmarks, abstract learning icons, and a brain processing information.

slides.title: Prerequisites
content: Basic computer literacy.
An interest in Artificial Intelligence.
narration: To get the most from this tutorial, you should have:
Basic computer literacy.
Also, an interest in Artificial Intelligence will be helpful.
slides.image_prompt: A person with a lightbulb above head, thinking, surrounded by tech symbols.

slides.title: System Requirements
content: A computer or smartphone.
An internet connection.
A web browser.
narration: For hands-on practice, you will need:
A computer or smartphone.
An active internet connection.
And a web browser to access online tools.
slides.image_prompt: Icons of a desktop computer, a mobile phone, a Wi-Fi symbol, and a browser window, all connected.

slides.title: What is Generative AI?
content: AI that creates new, original content.
Generates text, images, code, audio, video.
Shift from 'predictive' to 'generative' capabilities.
narration: Remember when AI just predicted things?
Now, Generative AI creates!
It produces new, original content.
Think of text, images, code, or even video.
slides.image_prompt: An AI robot hand sketching a diverse range of items: text, a landscape, code snippets, a musical note, and a video play button, all coming from its fingertips.

slides.title: Proprietary AI: The Walled Gardens
content: Developed and owned by private companies.
Limited access to inner workings.
Examples: OpenAI (GPT), Google (Gemini).
Advantages: High performance, dedicated support.
Disadvantages: High cost, vendor lock-in, less transparency.
narration: First, let us understand Proprietary AI.
These models are owned by private companies.
Access to their code is usually restricted.
Examples include OpenAI's GPT and Google's Gemini.
They offer cutting-edge performance and support.
But, they come with high costs and less transparency.
slides.image_prompt: A tall, imposing digital wall with a futuristic gate, symbolizing closed-off technology. Include small logos of major tech companies faintly visible behind the wall.

slides.title: Open Source AI: The Open Fields
content: Code and architecture are publicly available.
Anyone can inspect, use, modify, distribute.
Examples: Meta (Llama), Stability AI (Stable Diffusion).
Hugging Face is a central hub.
Advantages: Transparency, customizability, cost-effective.
narration: Next, we have Open Source AI.
Here, the underlying code is public.
Anyone can use, modify, or share it.
Meta's Llama and Stable Diffusion are examples.
Hugging Face is a major platform for this.
Benefits include transparency, customization, and lower costs.
slides.image_prompt: A vast, open digital field stretching to the horizon, with diverse users collaboratively planting and growing digital crops. Interconnected lines represent community and sharing.

slides.title: Why Choose Open Source AI?
content: Cost efficiency: Run locally or on cheaper infrastructure.
Customization: Fine-tune models with your own data.
Transparency: Audit for bias, understand behavior.
Community: Leverage collective intelligence and rapid innovation.
narration: Why is Open Source AI a strategic choice?
It offers great cost efficiency.
You can run models locally or on cheaper servers.
Customization is key; fine-tune with your data.
Transparency allows bias checks and better understanding.
slides.image_prompt: Four interconnected icons: a piggy bank (cost-efficiency), a customizable gear (customization), an open book (transparency), and a group of people working together (community).

slides.title: Summary of Key Points
content: Generative AI creates new content.
Proprietary AI is closed, powerful, but costly.
Open Source AI is open, flexible, and community-driven.
Prompt Engineering is crucial for good AI output.
narration: Let's quickly recap what we learned.
Generative AI creates new content, not just predicts.
Proprietary AI offers polish but with a price.
Open Source AI gives power, flexibility, and community.
Remember, prompt engineering is your superpower.
slides.image_prompt: A concise mind map showing connections between 'Generative AI', 'Proprietary AI', 'Open Source AI', and 'Prompt Engineering', with small descriptive icons for each.

slides.title: Assignment: Practice Prompting
content: Visit a free online Gen AI demo (e.g., a Hugging Face Space).
Experiment with text or image generation.
Start with a basic prompt.
Then, refine it to include more details and context.
Observe how your output changes with better prompts.
narration: Now for a small assignment.
Visit a free online Generative AI demo.
Try out a Hugging Face Space for text or images.
Start with a simple prompt, like 'Write a story'.
Then, make it specific.
Add details like audience, length, and tone.
slides.image_prompt: A user interacting with an AI chat interface on a screen, showing a basic prompt evolving into a detailed, creative prompt. Two different AI outputs are shown side-by-side, one generic, one rich.
